orindo saw a kindred soul and likened

his work and theology Veer towards a

she is the Golden Bridge the wonderful

is she a power of Silence in the depths

sons the light that leans from the

Evolution through numerous means of

whole Shri endo's father was an
assistant surgeon and wanted his
children to have a purely accidental
education away from the influence of
East and with an understanding of
Christianity and so arendo Goos started
at Loretto Convent and at the tender age
of seven with his brothers he was sent
to St Paul's School in London and then
King's College Cambridge academically
arundo excelled gaining scholarships for
most of his tenure and then even went on
to clear the civil services examination
however filled with promise and
aspiration this is when began Shri
arabindo disenchantment from the British
and an understanding of the Indian
condition after excusing himself from
British service arabindo Kosh found
himself as a secretary to the Maharaja
of gar in 1893 he went on to become an
English professor and then vice
principal of Baroda College a lot of
poetries published in the years to come
found orindo pen Strokes during this
time he also reacquainted himself with
Indian languages his Soul's poetry
blossomed and he slowly began to find
his voice in regards to India and the
Freedom Movement the 12 years spent in
service to the royal family of Baroda
readied him for his short but impactful
contribution to the Indian independence
struggle with his nationalist fire
burning arabindo Goos moved to Kolkata
in 1906 and in 1907 at an Indian
National Congress session chaired by
dhai narui he was instrumental in
creating the four-fold principles of the
independence movement swaraj swadesh
boycott and National Education but
slowly his views began to turn to the
extremists his own high point was at
chairing a nationalist conference which
saw the Divide of extremists and
moderates on his part he was the first
to demand complete independence from the
British where others were seeking only
partial
autonomy arendo found supporters to his
methods and started a newspaper
addressing fundamental concerns of the
Indians the BND maam ran for 2 years
regularly and all across India until
1908 when orindo was implicated and
arrested in the alipore bomb case owing
to his brothers revolutionary group
which was connected to the alipore
bombing orindo Kos spent a year in
British prison the British deemed him
the most dangerous man in the continent
at the time and implicated him but there
his time was well spent during the
year's confinement he practiced yoga
extensively and to his later admissions
had Mystic Visions repeatedly hearing
the voice of Swami Vive Anand and the
god
[Music]
Krishna a year prior to his arrest
during a visit to Baroda arabinda was
introduced to yoga and its potential he
practiced pranayam prior to it familiar
with its capacities to Aid mental
strength and Acumen at first his
interest in yoga was in the hope of
acquiring psychic forces that could Aid
against the British for Independence in
1907 arabindo met a yoga instructor
basar leel who taught him how to use
yoga to quieten his mind orindo the good
student that he was in the short tenure
absorbed all that he could the practice
that would then alter his life a year
later whilst in
[Music]
confinement it was vasudev who
surrounded me I walked under the
branches of the tree in front of my cell
but it was not the tree I knew it was
vasudev it was SRI Krishna whom I saw
standing there and holding over me his
shade I looked at the bars of my cell
the very greting that did Duty for a
door and again I saw vasudev it was
Naran who was guarding and standing
Sentry over me or I lay on the coarse
blankets that were given to me for a
couch and felt the arms of Shri Krishna
around me the arms of my friend and
lover this was the first use of the
deeper Vision he gave me I looked at the
prisoners in the jail the thieves the
murderers the swindlers and as I looked
at them saw vasudev it was Nar whom I
found in these darkened souls and
misused bodies of his time in prison
arabindo has described detailed
descriptions in his writings he spoke
often of the inhuman treatment and
torturous surroundings at one point he
shared a cell with several others
although by then he was already
withdrawn into himself he attempted to
understand the very nature of inner
divinity
and in his stuper it seemed even the
very imprisonment was merely a guise to
get him closer to God where on one hand
the sheer living conditions and hygiene
Allowed by the British were deplorable
on the other the depths of that
suffering allowed Shri arabindo to

whether he's in the company of men or

all good Lord had yet again made

to focus his energies to evolving

the front lines of the independence
movement
I made danger my helper and chose pain

Drew out of grief force and returned

the perfect way arendo had always
supported secret revolutionary groups in
his own right and at first took a
passive public stance this had slowly
changed and he supported and propelled
Bal gangadhar tilak to take charge as
the extremists exerted the moderates to
take more decisive steps he had also
been previously prosecuted for sedition
and acquitted at the time that arabindo
was running two simultaneous weekly
Publications the kogan in English and
one in Bengali the G he got wind of
another warrant that had been falsified
against him the third so far he felt
compelled to recognize that the nation
was not yet sufficiently trained to
carry out his policy and program he
resolved therefore to withdraw from the
political field at least for a time in
1910 he secretly escaped to pondicherry
which was under French rule at the time
what was intended as a brief sergeon for
survival
was where arendo was then to spend the
rest of his life eventually he cut off
all connection with politics and refused
repeatedly to accept the presidentship
of the National Congress in 1914 after 4
years of Silent yoga he began the
publication of a philosophical monthly
the Arya in 1901 prior to his having
returned to India arabindo Goos was
married to munal BOS in 1918 during the
influenza epidemic Ranos passed
away Mera alasa had a fascinating life
of her own prior to her meeting with
Shri arabindo the mother for according
to Shri arabindo she emed all the
beneficient maternal aspects of the
Divine energy Shakti in her manifest
form mea was born in 18 78 and married
to noted French painter franois Henry
Moret in
1897 she was known to have mystical
visions and psychic episodes since
childhood and often saw mystical figures
in Vivid apparitions one of whom she
addressed as Krishna without any
guidance she felt a divine presence and
by the time she was 20 Came Upon a yoga
book by Swami Vive Anand that allowed
her to cultivate yoga as a practice in
1905 she ran into max Theon an occultist
and the founder of the cosmic movement
in France and also known for his
Association to Madame blavatsky Max
wrote in English and it had been poorly
translated in French and mea alfasa
moriset went on to correct his articles
amongst other philosophical works for a
French magazine called rev cosmik during
this time mea cultivated deep occult and
spiritual learnings mea and franois
Henry moriset divorced in
1908 after spending time with Max's
group mea alasa went on to describe the
four assuras as a type of phenomenon
achieved or embed by some of these
spiritualists one of whom she later
married Paul Richard Mera had called him
the assura of falsehood and originally
married him for convenience so he could
gain custody of his three children by
his last wife on some level mea alfasa
had also hoped to cure and heal the soul
of her new husband and change him from
his demonic ways mea and Richard visited
Shri arabindo at his ashram in
1912 but as the first world war broke
out returned to France in 1914 mea
instinctively saw the evolved soul of
Shri arabindo helping lay the groundwork
on Foundation to the ashram and
returning in 1920 to get more deeply

because truth is not linear but Global

basis according to Sri arabindo integral
yoga is in its nature a synthesis that
takes within itself all the past yogic
efforts of man the sad or practice of
integral yoga does not proceed through
any set mental teaching or prescribed
forms of meditation mantras or others
but by aspiration by a
self-concentration inwards or upwards by
a self-opening to an influence to the
divine power the primary method is the
way to devotion and surrender which he
States is as a psychic movement that
ultimately results into the removal of
the ego the second is the way to
knowledge which is Guided by meditation
and quietude the third is Yoga by works
which involves two methods the first in
separation of inner Natures as the
passive quiet part and the outer active
part the other method is to consecrate
all works in the service of another the
Divine the mother the guru or the goal
the object of yoga according to him was
in entering the divine presence a Divine
Consciousness and then in allowing
ourselves through our love and will to
become instruments of the Divine the
principles and realization of integral
yoga were in this Union and
understanding of divinity
and upon feeling it to be guided
psychically by our inner divine nature
he often referred to the superm mind or
an overmind that is a state that guides
us through the recesses of the
subconsciousness that orindo cited is
how we know our individual and
subjective
godhead SRI arabindo was nominated for
the Nobel Prize in literature in 1943
and nobbel Prize for Peace in 1950 for
his innumerable contributions in the
field of poetry spirituality and
